Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>Another useful thing about speciation, as I mentioned in my previous 
>post, is that it prevents bloat.  It ensures that small genomes will 
>persist as long as they are competitive, since they won't be mixing 
>with, and don't have to compete directly for offspring with other 
>more complex species.
>  
>
OK but as I said in an earlier email, if the evolution stops progressing 
because the problem is too hard, or all of the species are bogged down 
in local maxima, then the simple species will become gradually reduced 
and bloat will set in. Protection of simple structure is only assured 
while evolution is progressing, I think that is where the source of our 
disharmony lies. :)

Colin.
